title: Tones and I sets sights on breaking Ed Sheeran's record of longest running No.1 artist in Australia
text:
She went from busking in Byron Bay to topping the charts with her catchy tune Dance Monkey in just a matter of months.

And on Sunday, Tones and I (aka Toni Watson) reflected on her recent success and what it means to potentially break Ed Sheeran's 14-week run with Shape Of You for the longest-running No. 1 single in Australian history.

Speaking to The Daily Telegraph, the 19-year-old said she never imagined the song, which is in its 11th straight week at the top of the Aria charts, would be so successful.

Chart topping! Tones and I (pictured) reflected on her recent success and what it means to potentially break Ed Sheeran's 14-week run with Shape Of You

'I didn't think it would be me. You know the saying that it just wouldn't happen to someone like me and it kind of loses its value because people say it a lot. Then when you think about it, that is exactly what you want to say,' Tones and I said.

With the song already overtaking Justice Crew's Que Sera as the longest running Australian artist at the top, she only has another three weeks to break the overall record.

In addition to topping the local charts, the track has also reached number one in the UK, Slovakia, Scotland, Hungary, Finland and Germany.

So surreal! Tones and I (pictured) said she never imagined Dance Monkey, which is in its 11th straight week at the top of the Aria charts, would beat the record

Award buzz! The success of the track has also resulted in eight ARIA Awards nominations for Tones and I (pictured), including Best Female Artist, Breakthrough Artist and Song Of The Year

The success of the track has also resulted in eight ARIA Awards nominations, including Best Female Artist, Breakthrough Artist and Song Of The Year.

Tones and I, who has signed with Sony Music Australia, went on to say that she's still amazed at how much her life has changed in just a matter of months.

'In March this year I had no idea what was about to happen,' she said, referring to living out of her van and busking for a living.

New life! Tones and I (pictured), who has signed with Sony Music Australia, said she's still amazed at how much her life has changed in just a matter of months

Despite her overnight success, Tones and I reflected on her humble beginnings, saying she misses the old days sleeping on a mattress on the floor of her van.

'I know I wasn't selling out shows or making any of those big marks on the country but I was living off my music and I was happy.

'I have more freedom (now) to do whatever I want than I'd ever had in my life but the one thing that I can't do is go back and live that life again, which is crazy,' she said.
description: She went from busking in Byron Bay to topping the charts with her catchy tune Dance Monkey in just a matter of months.
authors: Mark Brook For Daily Mail Australia
